Original: La gloria di colui che tutto move per l’universo penetra, e risplende in una parte più e meno altrove
Translate_en_1: The strength of the One who gives movement to everything extends throughout the Cosmos and shines brighter in some parts, less in others.

Original: Nel ciel che più de la sua luce prende fu’ io, e vidi cose che ridire né sa né può chi di là sù discende
Translate_en_1: My experience in Heaven, where light is much more intense, has allowed me to see things that anyone who has not been immersed in its greatness would not know how to describe.

Original: perché appressando sé al suo disire, nostro intelletto si profonda tanto, che dietro la memoria non può ire
Translate_en_1: Coming close to the dream to which our minds longed, they immersed themselves so deeply that not even the memory could accompany them.

Original: Veramente quant’ io del regno santo ne la mia mente potei far tesoro, sarà ora materia del mio canto
Translate_en_1: The object of my song will be what remains imprinted on me in the memory of the holy kingdom.

Original: O buono Appollo, a l’ultimo lavoro fammi del tuo valor sì fatto vaso, come dimandi a dar l’amato alloro
Translate_en_1: Oh, benevolent Apollo, give me the necessary inspiration to finish the last Song so that we can deserve your divine poetic crown.

Original: Infino a qui l’un giogo di Parnaso assai mi fu

Original: ma or con amendue m’è uopo intrar ne l’aringo rimaso

Translate_en_1: Blow in my soul, like a wind that frees Marsia from her limitations.

Translate_en_1: others, with louder voices than I, will ask that Cirra accept their prayers

Translate_en_1: ?If you, love that governs Heaven, were the last to create one me, will you know that you would enlighten my life with your light?

Translate_en_1: "My enormous wonder has now subsided.

Translate_en_1: Sometimes, the creature's reason has the opportunity to get away from this course, having the power to deviate on another path, although it is well directed.

Translate_en_1: You must no longer be surprised if I judge correctly, your progress as a river flowing from the mountain to the valley.

Translate_en_1: Those glorious ones, when they arrived in Colchis, did not surprise so much of Jason's metamorphosis from warrior to peasant as you will marvel.

Original: Beatrice in suso, e io in lei guardava

Original: Io rispuosi
Translate_en_1: I replied

Original: Ma ditemi

Translate_en_1: You will realize that your opinion is wrong if you listen carefully as I intend to argue.

Original: Da essa vien ciò che da luce a luce par differente, non da denso e raro
Translate_en_1: .The lighting of the stars is different because of their variability, not because they have a different density.

Original: essa è formal principio che produce, conforme a sua bontà, lo turbo e ’l chiaro»
Translate_en_1: His goodness generates opacity and lightness, this being the formal principle.

Translate_en_1: The warmth of the sun that had previously warmed my heart of love had revealed me with arguments both for and against the truth of its sweet beauty.

Translate_en_1: What is intact and what is vulnerable are emanations of that Idea created by God, through the spiritual strength of the Holy Spirit.

Translate_en_1: Because of the brilliant glow of the Father, the Son and the Holy Spirit, there can be no separation between them.

Original: per sua bontate il suo raggiare aduna, quasi specchiato, in nove sussistenze, etternalmente rimanendosi una
Translate_en_1: For his goodness, the nine angelic choirs reflect his divine rays as in a mirror, always remaining one being.

Original: Quindi discende a l’ultime potenze giù d’atto in atto, tanto divenendo, che più non fa che brevi contingenze
Translate_en_1: From Heaven to Heaven, he descends toward material creatures to such a minimal point that he generates ephemeral goods.

Original: e queste contingenze essere intendo le cose generate, che produce con seme e sanza seme il ciel movendo
Translate_en_1: and I mean that these ephemeral elements come from the creation of Heaven with their movement, whether with seed or without.

Original: La cera di costoro e chi la duce non sta d’un modo
Translate_en_1: The essence of these creatures and the influence of the heavens are not equivalent.

Original: e però sotto ’l segno idëale poi più e men traluce
Translate_en_1: As a result, they reflect a divine vision of some level, though to a lesser or greater degree.

Original: Ond’ elli avvien ch’un medesimo legno, secondo specie, meglio e peggio frutta
Translate_en_1: Trees of the same species produce fruit in a different way, some better and others worse.

Original: e voi nascete con diverso ingegno
Translate_en_1: and you men are endowed with a different nature

Translate_en_1: If the substance were purer and the celestial qualities were exercised with excellence, divine enlightenment would emerge impeccably.

Original: ma la natura la dà sempre scema, similemente operando a l’artista ch’a l’abito de l’arte ha man che trema
Translate_en_1: Nature offers matter in an unperfect way, as if the artist was trying to paint with a trembling hand.

Original: Però se ’l caldo amor la chiara vista de la prima virtù dispone e segna, tutta la perfezion quivi s’acquista
Translate_en_1: If the Holy Spirit infuses the light of divine strength, how much then created is completely impeccable.

Original: Così fu fatta già la terra degna di tutta l’animal perfezïone
Translate_en_1: The Earth was created perfect for living creatures.

Original: così fu fatta la Vergine pregna

Original: sì ch’io commendo tua oppinïone, che l’umana natura mai non fue né fia qual fu in quelle due persone
Translate_en_1: I agree with you that humanity cannot under any circumstances be considered perfect, both in individuals and as a whole.

Original: Or s’i’ non procedesse avanti più,
Translate_en_1: If I didn't add anything else,

Original: ‘Dunque, come costui fu sanza pare?’
Translate_en_1: Why can Solomon be considered unparalleled?

Original: comincerebber le parole tue
Translate_en_1: You'd start to say

Original: Ma perché paia ben ciò che non pare, pensa chi era, e la cagion che ’l mosse, quando fu detto “Chiedi”, a dimandare
Translate_en_1: Think about who was the conductor and what prompted him to ask for wisdom when God offered him the opportunity to grant him a desire.

Original: Non ho parlato sì, che tu non posse ben veder ch’el fu re, che chiese senno acciò che re sufficïente fosse
Translate_en_1: I didn't say anything to make you realize that he was a king and that, in order to best exercise his role as sovereign, he needed wisdom.

Original: non per sapere il numero in che enno li motor di qua sù, o se necesse con contingente mai necesse fenno
Translate_en_1: There is no need to know the number of angels, nor to know whether a necessary premise and a contingent have ever led to an inevitable result.

Original: non si est dare primum motum esse, o se del mezzo cerchio far si puote trïangol sì ch’un retto non avesse
Translate_en_1: To determine whether a first motion can be originated from another motion or if it is possible to draw a non-rectangular triangle inside a semicircle.

Translate_en_1: If you take into account the idea expressed earlier, what I meant as unparalleled wisdom is nothing but the wisdom of a ruler.

Original: e se al “surse” drizzi li occhi chiari, vedrai aver solamente respetto ai regi, che son molti, e ’ buon son rari
Translate_en_1: Remembering when I said the word "surse," you can guess that I wanted to emphasize that, while there are many sovereigns, only a few can be considered good.

Original: Con questa distinzion prendi ’l mio detto
Translate_en_1: Understand my words with these distinctions

Original: e così puote star con quel che credi del primo padre e del nostro Diletto
Translate_en_1: Their vision aligns with what you believe about the Eternal Father and His Beloved Creature.

Original: E questo ti sia sempre piombo a’ piedi, per farti mover lento com’ uom lasso e al sì e al no che tu non vedi
Translate_en_1: Be sure to proceed slowly and cautiously as when walking heavily after a long day, taking time before making a judgment on something you cannot understand.

Original: ché quelli è tra li stolti bene a basso, che sanza distinzione afferma e nega ne l’un così come ne l’altro passo
Translate_en_1: He who has not thought, whether by claiming that he denies, is foolish.

Original: perch’ elli ’ncontra che più volte piega l’oppinïon corrente in falsa parte, e poi l’affetto l’intelletto lega
Translate_en_1: Frequently, mass thinking leads to an erroneous conviction and attachment to one's own idea prevents the brain from reflecting rationally.

Original: Vie più che ’ndarno da riva si parte, perché non torna tal qual e’ si move, chi pesca per lo vero e non ha l’arte
Translate_en_1: Those who do not have the proper competence to fish for the truth are in danger of returning in a worse condition to the one with which they left, without having achieved any result.

Translate_en_1: Parmenide, Melisso and Brisone proceeded without knowing the final destination, but this is a globally recognized reality.

Original: sì fé Sabellio e Arrio e quelli stolti che furon come spade a le Scritture in render torti li diritti volti
Translate_en_1: Sabellius, Arius, and those fools acted as if they were swords against the Scriptures, altering their right contours.

Translate_en_1: The one who tries to evaluate the crops before they are ripe should not act too hastily.

Original: ch’i’ ho veduto tutto ’l verno prima lo prun mostrarsi rigido e feroce, poscia portar la rosa in su la cima
Translate_en_1: During the winter, the plum appeared dry and withered, but with the coming of spring a rose bloomed on its branch.

Translate_en_1: I have observed a ship that, flying quickly along its trajectory, has then collapsed near the entrance of the port.

Original: Non creda donna Berta e ser Martino, per vedere un furare, altro offerere, vederli dentro al consiglio divino
Translate_en_1: Do not believe woman Berta and Ser Martino that God has already issued a verdict just because they saw a man steal and another make pious offerings.

Original: ché quel può surgere, e quel può cadere»

Translate_en_1: The water in a round pot flows from the center to the circumference and vice versa depending on whether the tray is pushed from inside or from outside.

Original: ne la mia mente fé sùbito caso questo ch’io dico, sì come si tacque la glorïosa vita di Tommaso,

Original: per la similitudine che nacque del suo parlare e di quel di Beatrice, a cui sì cominciar, dopo lui, piacque
Translate_en_1: Because of the similarity between his words and those of Beatrice, it was a pleasure for both of us to start talking.

Original: «A costui fa mestieri, e nol vi dice né con la voce né pensando ancora, d’un altro vero andare a la radice
Translate_en_1: To this person, even without expressing his own opinion voice or thoughts, he needs to discover the foundation of another reality.

Original: Diteli se la luce onde s’infiora vostra sustanza, rimarrà con voi etternalmente sì com’ ell’ è ora
Translate_en_1: of always Ask him if the brightness that revives your soul will be eternal, will shine forever with the same splendor.

Original: e se rimane, dite come, poi che sarete visibili rifatti, esser porà ch’al veder non vi nòi»
Translate_en_1: Tell him that after you are clothed with your body, no element should remain able to damage your sight.

Original: Come, da più letizia pinti e tratti, a la fïata quei che vanno a rota levan la voce e rallegrano li atti,

Translate_en_1: Those who complain that there is a cost to be paid to reach Heaven have not seen here the blessing of eternal rain.

Translate_en_1: God, who is one and eternal, rules the Trinity without being limited.

Translate_en_1: Those melodies, sung three times with such skill by those spirits, were so magnificent that any merit would be dignifiedly rewarded.

Original: E io udi’ ne la luce più dia del minor cerchio una voce modesta, forse qual fu da l’angelo a Maria, risponder
Translate_en_1: I remembered in the brightest brilliance of the central ring a kind voice, perhaps similar to that which the archangel Gabriel spoke with Mary in the Annunciation, echoing in response

Original: «Quanto fia lunga la festa di paradiso, tanto il nostro amore si raggerà dintorno cotal vesta
Translate_en_1: During our stay in Paradise, our passion for love will fill with splendor the environment that surrounds us.

Original: La sua chiarezza séguita l’ardore

Original: l’ardor la visïone, e quella è tanta, quant’ ha di grazia sovra suo valore
Translate_en_1: The divine vision brings with it an entirely special illumination, which God gives us as a sign of grace.

Original: Come la carne glorïosa e santa fia rivestita, la nostra persona più grata fia per esser tutta quanta
Translate_en_1: and incorruptibleOnce we have regained the glorious and holy physical form, we will again be appreciated for our unspoilt and unspoilt mysticism.

Original: per che s’accrescerà ciò che ne dona di gratüito lume il sommo bene, lume ch’a lui veder ne condiziona
Translate_en_1: The greater is the gift of God's grace that is granted to us, a gift that allows us to admire him.

Original: onde la visïon crescer convene, crescer l’ardor che di quella s’accende, crescer lo raggio che da esso vene
Translate_en_1: Since the sight of God will be even more alive, the desire for love that flows from it will intensify, just as the splendor emanated from it.

Original: Ma sì come carbon che fiamma rende, e per vivo candor quella soverchia, sì che la sua parvenza si difende
Translate_en_1: Like a piece of coal covered by the flame, its glowing white color is brighter, making it still visible.

Original: così questo folgór che già ne cerchia fia vinto in apparenza da la carne che tutto dì la terra ricoperchia
Translate_en_1: With this luminosity that surrounds us now, it will be defeated by the appearance of the body that has been buried in the earth.

Original: né potrà tanta luce affaticarne
Translate_en_1: We will not be blinded by his splendour.

Original: ché li organi del corpo saran forti a tutto ciò che potrà dilettarne»
Translate_en_1: By supporting our organs, we can enjoy the joy that awaits us.

Original: Tanto mi parver sùbiti e accorti e l’uno e l’altro coro a dicer «Amme»,
Translate_en_1: The two large groups of people immediately responded with "Amen" .

Original: che ben mostrar disio d’i corpi morti
Translate_en_1: So much so that they expressed a great desire to embrace their deceased bodies again.

Original: forse non pur per lor, ma per le mamme, per li padri e per li altri che fuor cari anzi che fosser sempiterne fiamme
Translate_en_1: Maybe not only for themselves, but also for the people they loved in life, they become souls that shine forever.

Original: Ed ecco intorno, di chiarezza pari, nascere un lustro sopra quel che v’era, per guisa d’orizzonte che rischiari
Translate_en_1: As if another light source were being added to the existing one, a brightness similar to a sky that lightens in the distance spread around.

Original: E sì come al salir di prima sera comincian per lo ciel nove parvenze,
Translate_en_1: As the twilight imbues the sky, we see the dazzling host of stars appear.

Original: sì che la vista pare e non par vera,
Translate_en_1: as if they were visible but also invisible

Original: parvemi lì novelle sussistenze cominciare a vedere, e fare un giro di fuor da l’altre due circunferenze
Translate_en_1: .It seemed to me that the new light rays of the blessing were moving around the other two halos.

Original: Oh vero sfavillar del Santo Spiro
Translate_en_1: Oh, mystical flame of the Holy Spirit

Original: come si fece sùbito e candente a li occhi miei che, vinti, nol soffriro
Translate_en_1: My gaze went down, abyssing in the light that had suddenly enlightened my eyes

Original: Ma Bëatrice sì bella e ridente mi si mostrò, che tra quelle vedute si vuol lasciar che non seguir la mente
Translate_en_1: Beatrice's beauty and joy were so great that I should give up describing her, as things too bright for human memory.

Original: Quindi ripreser li occhi miei virtute a rilevarsi
Translate_en_1: His presence gave me the strength to stand up vigorously.

Original: e vidimi translato sol con mia donna in più alta salute
Translate_en_1: I felt carried along with Beatrice to a higher level of happiness.

Original: Ben m’accors’ io ch’io era più levato, per l’affocato riso de la stella, che mi parea più roggio che l’usato
Translate_en_1: I realized that I had climbed higher, for the star had a red glow like fire and sparkled much more intensely than usual.

Original: Con tutto ’l core e con quella favella ch’è una in tutti, a Dio feci olocausto, qual conveniesi a la grazia novella
Translate_en_1: I have offered my life to God with all my heart and with that universal language that goes hand in hand with the new grace.

Original: E non er’ anco del mio petto essausto l’ardor del sacrificio, ch’io conobbi esso litare stato accetto e fausto
Translate_en_1: My sacrifice had not been in vain, for I realized that my prayer had been heard.

Original: ché con tanto lucore e tanto robbi m’apparvero splendor dentro a due raggi, ch’io dissi
Translate_en_1: By the two rays there had been lightning and blushing, so much so that I exclaimed

Original: «O Elïòs che sì li addobbi»
Translate_en_1: "O Lord, you make them so wonderful"

Original: Come distinta da minori e maggi lumi biancheggia tra ’ poli del mondo Galassia sì, che fa dubbiar ben saggi
Translate_en_1: Like a Milky Way, an enigmatic Galaxy that shines among the opposite celestial poles, dotted with stars of various splendour, enchants even the wise.

Original: sì costellati facean nel profondo Marte quei raggi il venerabil segno che fan giunture di quadranti in tondo
Translate_en_1: The two rays emitted by the lights formed in the depth of Mars a sacred sign similar to the division of the circle into four equal parts thanks to the axes.

Original: Qui vince la memoria mia lo ’ngegno
Translate_en_1: My poor memory prevails over my intelligence.

Original: ché quella croce lampeggiava Cristo, sì ch’io non so trovare essempro degno
Translate_en_1: It was said that that cross caused Christ to shine so magnificently, that there was no comparison worthy of describing it.

Original: ma chi prende sua croce e segue Cristo, ancor mi scuserà di quel ch’io lasso, vedendo in quell’ albor balenar Cristo

Original: moversi per lo raggio onde si lista talvolta l’ombra

Original: che, per sua difesa, la gente con ingegno e arte acquista
Translate_en_1: People defend themselves with creativity and art.

Original: E come giga e arpa, in tempra tesa di molte corde, fa dolce tintinno a tal da cui la nota non è intesa,

Original: così da’ lumi che lì m’apparinno s’accogliea per la croce una melode che mi rapiva, sanza intender l’inno
Translate_en_1: From those bright glows I saw, a cross melody carried me in the distance, even though I was unable to decipher that song.

Original: Ben m’accors’ io ch’elli era d’alte lode, però ch’a me venìa «Resurgi» e «Vinci» come a colui che non intende e ode
Translate_en_1: I understood that it was a deep praise, hearing the words "Risorgi" and "Vinci" as someone who listens but does not understand.

Original: Ïo m’innamorava tanto quinci, che ’nfino a lì non fu alcuna cosa che mi legasse con sì dolci vinci
Translate_en_1: I was so caught up in that song that there was nothing until then that it tied me up in such a sweet way.

Original: Forse la mia parola par troppo osa, posponendo il piacer de li occhi belli, ne’ quai mirando mio disio ha posa
Translate_en_1: Perhaps my statements are too bold, as they surpass the beauty of Beatrice's eyes admiring them with which all my thoughts find peace.

Original: ma chi s’avvede che i vivi suggelli d’ogne bellezza più fanno più suso, e ch’io non m’era lì rivolto a quelli,
Translate_en_1: Who understands that the higher you go, the more the signs of beauty gain power and I had not yet turned to that beautiful scenery?

Original: escusar puommi di quel ch’io m’accuso per escusarmi, e vedermi dir vero
Translate_en_1: I apologize for what I accuse myself of, and I hope you will accept my version of the facts as truthful.

Original: ché ’l piacer santo non è qui dischiuso, perché si fa, montando, più sincero
Translate_en_1: because it increases, the holy pleasure becomes ever brighter and purified

Original: Benigna volontade in che si liqua sempre l’amor che drittamente spira,
Translate_en_1: The will to express love in an appropriate way always produces a virtuous behavior.

Original: come cupidità fa ne la iniqua,
Translate_en_1: The desire for wealth is shown in a pinch of malice.

Original: silenzio puose a quella dolce lira,
Translate_en_1: The sweet lira was silenced.

Original: e fece quïetar le sante corde che la destra del cielo allenta e tira
Translate_en_1: and quieted the divinely sounding strings that God's hand stretched out and relaxed

Translate_en_1: Why do those souls ignore our prayers, even though they have all chosen to remain silent to encourage me?

Original: Bene è che sanza termine si doglia chi, per amor di cosa che non duri etternalmente, quello amor si spoglia

Original: Quale per li seren tranquilli e puri discorre ad ora ad or sùbito foco,
Translate_en_1: Like a falling star that illuminates the calm and the immaculate heavenly night,

Original: movendo li occhi che stavan sicuri, e pare stella che tramuti loco,
Translate_en_1: The tranquility of the gaze has been transformed, like a star dancing in the darkness.

Original: se non che da la parte ond’ e’ s’accende nulla sen perde, ed esso dura poco
Translate_en_1: At no point where light is made is hidden a star and the phenomenon lasts little.

Original: tale dal corno che ’n destro si stende a piè di quella croce corse un astro de la costellazion che lì resplende
Translate_en_1: One of the lights adorning the figure of the cross moved, from the right arm to the lower part.

Original: né si partì la gemma dal suo nastro, ma per la lista radïal trascorse, che parve foco dietro ad alabastro
Translate_en_1: The gem was hung from the ribbon, shining brightly like a fire behind an alabaster wall crossing the arm of the cross.

Original: Sì pïa l’ombra d’Anchise si porse, se fede merta nostra maggior musa, quando in Eliso del figlio s’accorse
Translate_en_1: The most important Musa tells us that Anchise's soul was moved intensely when he saw his son Aeneas in the Elysian Fields.

Original: «O sanguis meus, o superinfusa gratïa Deï, sicut tibi cui bis unquam celi ianüa reclusa?»
Translate_en_1: Oh, my descendant, what abundance of divine grace has been given to you, with you who have been twice admitted to the gates of Paradise?

Original: Così quel lume

Original: ond’ io m’attesi a lui

Original: poscia rivolsi a la mia donna il viso, e quinci e quindi stupefatto fui
Translate_en_1: Then I took a look at my partner, and both of them were beautiful to see.

Original: ché dentro a li occhi suoi ardeva un riso tal, ch’io pensai co’ miei toccar lo fondo de la mia gloria e del mio paradiso
Translate_en_1: Beatrice had such a bright smile that she made me feel the bottom of my joy and total bliss with my eyes.

Original: Indi, a udire e a veder giocondo, giunse lo spirto al suo principio cose, ch’io non lo ’ntesi, sì parlò profondo
Translate_en_1: The spirit, pleasantly visible and audible, added to what he had said other discourses so deep that they were not understood.

Original: né per elezïon mi si nascose, ma per necessità, ché ’l suo concetto al segno d’i mortal si soprapuose
Translate_en_1: He chose not to conceal the meaning, however he was forced to do so because the expressed idea exceeded the boundaries of human understanding.

Original: E quando l’arco de l’ardente affetto fu sì sfogato, che ’l parlar discese inver’ lo segno del nostro intelletto,
Translate_en_1: When his generous passion was expressed to the extreme consequences of our understanding,

Original: la prima cosa che per me s’intese,
Translate_en_1: I understand when he said that the first thing to do was

Original: «Benedetto sia tu», fu, «trino e uno, che nel mio seme se’ tanto cortese»
Translate_en_1: Praised be Thou, O triune God, for Thy great goodness unto my descendant.

Original: E seguì

Original: «Grato e lontano digiuno, tratto leggendo del magno volume du’ non si muta mai bianco né bruno, solvuto hai, figlio, dentro a questo lume in ch’io ti parlo,
Translate_en_1: Don't neglect your culture because being educated is a precious gift, O my son, you have finally realized the dream I had reading from that immutable volume. Don't underestimate the importance of knowledge, as possessing knowledge is a most precious gift.

Original: mercè di colei ch’a l’alto volo ti vestì le piume
Translate_en_1: Thank you for the wings that pushed me to fly so high

Original: Tu credi che a me tuo pensier mei da quel ch’è primo, così come raia da l’un, se si conosce, il cinque e ’l sei
Translate_en_1: You believe that your reasoning was inspired by a divine force, as if you were learning about unity, figures five and six might emerge.

Original: e però ch’io mi sia e perch’ io paia più gaudïoso a te, non mi domandi, che alcun altro in questa turba gaia
Translate_en_1: So, to show more joy in my presence than anyone else in this gathering of blessed ones, are you not questioning me about who I am?

Original: Tu credi ’l vero
Translate_en_1: Love is forever. You think love is eternal.

Original: ché i minori e ’ grandi di questa vita miran ne lo speglio in che, prima che pensi, il pensier pandi
Translate_en_1: In paradise, the luckiest and least fortunate souls look at the mirror in which your thought is reflected before you can predict it.

Original: ma perché ’l sacro amore in che io veglio con perpetüa vista e che m’asseta di dolce disïar, s’adempia meglio,
Translate_en_1: Despite the ardour of charity that I constantly feel thanks to the meditation on God and the sweet desire that comes from it, I hope that this passion can be fully fulfilled.

Original: la voce tua sicura, balda e lieta suoni la volontà, suoni ’l disio, a che la mia risposta è già decreta»
Translate_en_1: Your voice, confident and encouraging, expresses your will; let your desire ring out, to which I have already given a definitive answer.

Original: e arrisemi un cenno che fece crescer l’ali al voler mio

Original: e l’un da l’altro come iri da iri parea reflesso, e ’l terzo parea foco che quinci e quindi igualmente si spiri
Translate_en_1: The second looked like an echo of the first two, like a rainbow reflected by something else, and the third was like a flame emerging from the previous ones.

Original: Oh quanto è corto il dire e come fioco al mio concetto
Translate_en_1: There's not enough words in my vocabulary to describe what I remember!

Original: e questo, a quel ch’i’ vidi, è tanto, che non basta a dicer ‘poco’
Translate_en_1: Compared to what I saw, this too is so insignificant that it does not deserve even the adjective 'little'.

Original: O luce etterna che sola in te sidi, sola t’intendi, e da te intelletta e intendente te ami e arridi
Translate_en_1: O eternal light, which lives only in you and is conscious of itself, that you love and burn with charity in the act of fully perceiving your nature.

Original: Quella circulazion che sì concetta pareva in te come lume reflesso, da li occhi miei alquanto circunspetta,
Translate_en_1: After staring at him for a long time, that circle appeared as if it had its own life, similar to the reflection of something else.

Original: dentro da sé, del suo colore stesso, mi parve pinta de la nostra effige
Translate_en_1: it seemed that he had depicted on it, of the same color, the human image

Original: per che ’l mio viso in lei tutto era messo
Translate_en_1: I had laid all my eyes on her.

Original: Qual è ’l geomètra che tutto s’affige per misurar lo cerchio, e non ritrova, pensando, quel principio ond’ elli indige,
Translate_en_1: Like a geometry scholar, who does his best to measure the circumference but fails to discover the missing element, even if he thinks about it.

Original: tal era io a quella vista nova
Translate_en_1: It was like I was standing in front of a sublime show.

Original: veder voleva come si convenne l’imago al cerchio e come vi s’indova
Translate_en_1: I wanted to figure out where to put the image of man inside the circle and how to put it inside it.

Original: ma non eran da ciò le proprie penne
Translate_en_1: My wings weren't enough for a flight like this.

Original: se non che la mia mente fu percossa da un fulgore in che sua voglia venne
Translate_en_1: Suddenly, a shock struck my mind, finally allowing me to accomplish what I wanted.

Original: A l’alta fantasia qui mancò possa
Translate_en_1: My imagination failed to sustain height.

Original: ma già volgeva il mio disio e ’l velle, sì come rota ch’igualmente è mossa, l’amor che move il sole e l’altre stelle
Translate_en_1: My desire and will were governed by divine love that pushes the Sun and other stars forward as a wheel moved regularly.
